articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's defence minister ruled out any ceasefire in Lebanon until Israel's goals had been met.
articles.title: Israeli airstrikes hit Beirut suburbs

articles.author: Andrew Macaskill, Muvija M
articles.description: Welby resigned "in sorrow", saying he had failed to ensure there was a proper investigation into allegations of abuse by a volunteer at Christian summer camps decades ago.
articles.title: Justin Welby resigns as Archbishop of Canterbury over abuse scandal

articles.author: Richard Valdmanis
articles.description: U.N. atomic watchdog chief Rafael Grossi appealed to Iran's leadership on Tuesday to take steps to resolve longstanding issues with his agency a day before he arrives in the Iranian capital for crunch talks over its nuclear programme.
articles.title: 'Help us,' UN nuclear watchdog chief tells Iran ahead of visit

articles.author: Steven Scheer
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said in a direct message to Iranians on Tuesday that Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's government feared the people of Iran more than Israel.
articles.title: Netanyahu says Iran's government fears its people more than Israel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 20 people were killed and 13 injured in Israeli air strikes in the Mount Lebanon area, the Lebanese health ministry said on Tuesday.
articles.title: At least 20 killed in Israeli strikes on Mount Lebanon areas, ministry says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A hit-and-run attack at a sports centre in the southern Chinese city of Zhuhai killed 35 people and severely injured 43, local police said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Hit-and-run attack in southern China's Zhuhai kills 35

articles.author: Muvija M
articles.description: The archbishop of Canterbury, Justin Welby, resigned over an abuse cover-up scandal on Tuesday, marking an unprecedented moment for the Church of England.
articles.title: How will the next leader of the Church of England be picked?

articles.author: Ted Hesson
articles.description: Donald Trump is expected to take a slew of executive actions on his first day in the White House to ramp up immigration enforcement and roll back President Joe Biden’s flagship legal entry programs, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.
articles.title: Trump’s Day One: Deportations, border wall

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Jailed Belarusian dissident Maria Kalesnikava, a key figure in the opposition movement to President Alexander Lukashenko, was permitted to meet her father on Tuesday, the first time any picture of her has been seen in well over a year.
articles.title: Jailed Belarusian dissident Kalesnikava permitted visit with father

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: A federal jury on Tuesday found U.S. defense contractor CACI International liable for its role in torture at the Abu Ghraib prison near Baghdad during the Iraq war and ordered it to pay $42 million in damages.
articles.title: Jury finds US defense contractor liable in torture at Abu Ghraib prison
